result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Dale King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders bond in the amount of $200 to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:55 pm case called. Defendant Richard Dale King in court with attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record. Conflict of interest with Attorney Mann discussed and waived.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & No Contest to 16TR354.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads in Count 2 & dismisses outright 15TR3094. No statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to-15CM453-Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond to be applied.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given. 16TR354-$811.50 to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 6 month DL revocation, NO IID, OWI Assessment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 15, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann in court appearing via telephone.   Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Mann - will be meeting with both his clients next Monday and requests adjournment.  STC adjourned as requested.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard Dale King
Current: 8630 Savanna Oaks Bay Apt. F, Woodbury, MN 55125 United States  (Effective: 01-12-2016)
Prior: 8785 Courthouse Blvd, Inver Grove Hts, MN 55077
Defendant's Authorization to Appear and Act

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

15CM453 & 15TR3094-2:07 pm cases called. Attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding dual representation-requests conflict waiver be submitted to court.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered to both.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.
